rename.from: `?` parameter from Route is overriden instead of merged
rename.to: `?` parameter from Route class is overriden instead of merged

issue.title: Fix Route::parseRequest() not being able to emit query parameters

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
If the result of a `parseRequest()` call includes a `?` key, that value should be merged with the actual query string parameters. This is useful when building simpler aliases for URLs with complex query string parameters.

This could also be backported to 4.x

Fixes #18245

body:
@markstory 
After some more testing i came to conclusion that this query param merging logic should be moved from `\Cake\Routing\RouteCollection::parseRequest()` to `\Cake\Routing\Route\Route::parseRequest()`

Current implementation suggested by me does not allow altering or unsetting existing query params (array merge will still override changes in them).
Moving this query param merging logic to `\Cake\Routing\Route\Route::parseRequest()` would give full freedom to custom Route classes in that regard

@markstory Another thing to consider:
```php
debug($this->getRequest()->getParam('?') == $this->getRequest()->getQueryParams())
```
Will return `false` for routes that alter `?` param
This can be surprising and it should be documented

> After some more testing i came to conclusion that this query param merging logic should be moved from \Cake\Routing\RouteCollection::parseRequest() to \Cake\Routing\Route\Route::parseRequest()

I don't know how we would do that without breaking existing Route implementations, as we can't assume that they will call parent.

> Another thing to consider ... Will return false for routes that alter ? param. This can be surprising and it should be documented

I wouldn't have expected those two values to be the same, `Request::getQueryParams()` should always reflect the query string that was included in the request URI. Query parameters added during route parsing are outside of the request URI.

issue.title: PaginatorHelper fails to pass all params to the next page

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
### Description

Related to [#18245 ](https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/18245#issuecomment-2751211662)

PaginatorHelper does not pass params from custom Route class to the next page
This happens because it uses `->getQueryParams()`  method instead of `->getParam('?', [])` here:
https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/blob/32f82a644f875702252482b94943076759ec3564/src/View/Helper/PaginatorHelper.php#L112


### CakePHP Version

4.x - 5.x
